definition: Truthful and straightforward; frank.
example: She gave a candid interview about her experiences.

definition: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
example: The politician gave an eloquent speech about social justice.

definition: Feeling or expressing great happiness and triumph.
example: The crowd was jubilant after their team won the championship.

definition: Full of or shedding light; bright or shining, especially in the dark.
example: The luminous moonlight lit up the night.

definition: Attractively unusual or old-fashioned.
example: They stayed in a quaint cottage during their vacation.

definition: Able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.
example: The human spirit is remarkably resilient.

definition: Diligent, thorough, and extremely attentive to details.
example: The accountant was scrupulous in her work, ensuring that every entry was accurate.

definition: Characterized by conflict, disorder, or confusion; not stable or calm.
example: The plane experienced turbulent conditions during the flight.

definition: Present, appearing, or found everywhere.
example: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.

definition: Playfully quaint or fanciful, especially in an appealing and amusing way.
example: The story was filled with whimsical characters and magical adventures.

definition: The action of following or chasing someone or something.
example: The police were in pursuit of the suspect.

definition: (Of an idea or opinion) formed before having the evidence for its truth.
example: She had preconceived notions about the new employee based solely on hearsay.

definition: Having or showing great enthusiasm in pursuit of a cause or objective.
example: She was a zealous supporter of the new environmental policy.

definition: Preconceived opinion that is not based on reason or actual experience.
example: The organization's goal is to reduce racial prejudice within the community.

definition: Standing out so as to be clearly visible.
example: His bright red coat made him conspicuous in the crowd.

definition: Delicious or delightful.
example: The chef prepared a delectable meal for the guests.

definition: Inspiring fear or respect through being impressively large, powerful, intense, or capable.
example: The team faced a formidable opponent in the championship game.

definition: Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.
example: The garrulous host entertained his guests with endless stories.

definition: In accordance with the highest standards; faultless.
example: Her impeccable manners made a lasting impression on her hosts.

definition: Having, showing, or done with good judgment or sense.
example: He made a judicious decision to invest in the new technology.

definition: A constantly changing pattern or sequence of elements.
example: The sunset turned the sky into a kaleidoscope of colors.

definition: Sumptuously rich, elaborate, or luxurious.
example: The couple hosted a lavish wedding reception for their guests.

definition: A deep, long-lasting sadness.
example: She felt a sense of melancholy wash over her as she looked at the old photographs.

definition: Wicked or criminal.
example: The villain's nefarious plans were eventually thwarted by the hero.

definition: Richly luxurious and lavish.
example: The opulent ballroom was adorned with crystal chandeliers and gold decorations.

definition: Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.
example: Paris is the quintessential city of romance.

definition: The occurrence of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
example: Meeting her at the coffee shop was pure serendipity.

definition: Holding firmly to something; persistent.
example: Her tenacious attitude helped her overcome many obstacles.

definition: Fully in agreement.
example: The board's decision to approve the project was unanimous.

definition: Attractively lively and animated.
example: Her vivacious personality made her the life of the party.

definition: Showing or characterized by quick and inventive verbal humor.
example: He was known for his witty remarks.

definition: A short extract from a film, broadcast, or piece of music or writing.
example: She read an excerpt from her new novel at the book launch.

definition: Look thoughtfully for a long time at; think about.
example: He stood at the edge of the cliff to contemplate the vast expanse of the ocean.

definition: In an attractive, careful way, especially used about something small or having small movements.
example: She picked up the cup daintily with her little finger extended.

definition: Anxious or fearful that something bad or unpleasant will happen.
example: She was apprehensive about the upcoming exam.

definition: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.
example: He was meticulous in his work, ensuring every detail was perfect.

definition: Open to more than one interpretation; having a double meaning.
example: The wording of the contract was ambiguous, leading to different interpretations.

definition: Absolutely necessary; essential.
example: Water is indispensable for life.

definition: Wishing to do one's work or duty well and thoroughly.
example: She is a conscientious worker, always putting in her best effort.

definition: Full of energy, excitement, and cheerfulness.
example: The children were exuberant in their play.

definition: Featuring new methods; advanced and original.
example: The company is known for its innovative technology.

definition: To light up or make clear.
example: The streetlights illuminate the roads at night.

definition: Happening or doing something at the agreed or proper time; on time.
example: She is always punctual for her appointments.

definition: To make more noticeable or prominent.
example: The dress accentuates her figure perfectly.

definition: A noisy argument or disagreement, especially in public.
example: The altercation between the two drivers escalated quickly.

definition: A person who publicly supports or recommends a particular cause or policy.
example: She is an advocate for environmental protection.

definition: Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior.
example: Her capricious nature makes it hard to predict her reactions.

definition: To expose the falseness or hollowness of a myth, idea, or belief.
example: The scientist aimed to debunk myths about climate change.

definition: A feeling of intense longing for something.
example: She had a yearning to travel the world.

definition: A gentle, mild breeze, often associated with the west wind.
example: The zephyr that came through the open window was a welcome relief on the hot summer day.

definition: Highly skilled or proficient at something.
example: She is adept at playing the piano, having practiced diligently for years.

definition: Hostile and aggressive.
example: His belligerent attitude made it difficult to have a peaceful conversation.

definition: Having knowledge or being aware of something.
example: She was fully cognizant of the potential risks involved in the project.

definition: Having a great deal of money; wealthy.
example: The affluent neighborhood was filled with mansions and luxury cars.

definition: Having or showing zeal; fervent and enthusiastic.
example: She was a zealous supporter of the local football team.

definition: Vivacious and enthusiastic; giving off bubbles (liquid).
example: Her effervescent personality made her the life of the party.

definition: Having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations or people and turn this to one's advantage.
example: He was an astute businessman, always finding a way to maximize profits.

definition: Intelligently analytical and clear-thinking; able to express ideas and opinions clearly and directly.
example: Her incisive comments during the meeting impressed her colleagues.

definition: Fond of company; sociable.
example: His gregarious nature ensured he was always surrounded by friends.

definition: Having or showing sensitive insight.
example: Her perceptive observations revealed the true nature of the situation.

definition: So delicate or precise as to be difficult to analyze or describe.
example: The artist used subtle shades of color to convey a sense of peace.

definition: Showing or having skill, especially with the hands.
example: A dexterous guitarist can easily switch between complex chords.

definition: Lasting for a very short time.
example: The beauty of the cherry blossoms is ephemeral, lasting only a few weeks each spring.

definition: Sparing or economical with regard to money or food.
example: By being frugal and cutting unnecessary expenses, they were able to save a considerable amount of money.

definition: Acting or done quickly and without thought or care.
example: Her impetuous decision to quit her job resulted in a period of financial instability.

definition: Place or deal with close together for contrasting effect.
example: The artist juxtaposed the dark and light colors to create a striking visual effect.

definition: Characterized by bitterness or sharpness of manner, speech, or temper.
example: The debate over the new policy was acrimonious, with both sides resorting to personal attacks.

definition: Done openly and unashamedly; very obvious.
example: His blatant disregard for the rules could not be ignored.

definition: Mutual trust and friendship among people who spend a lot of time together.
example: The camaraderie among the team members was evident in their seamless coordination.

definition: To make someone or something weak or feeble.
example: The long illness had debilitated him, leaving him unable to work.

definition: Cheerful and full of energy.
example: Her ebullient personality made her a great host for the party.

definition: Very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail.
example: He was fastidious in his work, always double-checking every detail before submission.

definition: To shock or excite someone into taking action.
example: The urgent need for reform galvanized the community into action.

definition: Unfortunate; having bad luck.
example: The hapless traveler missed his flight and lost his luggage.

definition: A mode of behavior or way of thought peculiar to an individual.
example: One of her idiosyncrasies is always wearing mismatched socks.

definition: The fact of two things being seen or placed close together with contrasting effect.
example: The artist's use of juxtaposition highlights the contrast between the urban and the rural.

definition: Strange or odd; unusual.
example: She had a peculiar feeling that someone was watching her.

definition: Having or showing the ability to speak fluently and coherently.
example: She was unable to articulate her feelings about the situation.

definition: Unnecessary, especially through being more than enough.
example: Clearing out superfluous clutter can help you focus better.

definition: Disagreement, typically when prolonged, public, and heated.
example: The new policy has caused a lot of controversy.

definition: Make or become less.
example: The medicine helped to diminish the pain.

definition: Fearless; adventurous (often used for rhetorical or humorous effect).
example: The intrepid explorer ventured into the unknown jungle.

definition: Remarkably or impressively great in extent, size, or degree.
example: The prodigious talent of the young musician amazed everyone.

definition: (Of an argument, theory, or policy) logical and consistent.
example: She presented a coherent argument that impressed the committee.

definition: The feeling that someone or something is unworthy of one's consideration or respect; contempt.
example: She looked at the messy room with disdain.

definition: A person or thing that is mysterious, puzzling, or difficult to understand.
example: Her sudden departure remains an enigma.

definition: To free or remove from an entanglement or difficulty.
example: She managed to extricate herself from the complicated situation.

definition: The practice of claiming to have moral standards or beliefs to which one's own behavior does not conform.
example: His hypocrisy was evident when he preached about honesty but was found cheating.

definition: To surrender or cease resisting, often under agreed conditions.
example: After a long negotiation, they decided to capitulate to the enemy's demands.

definition: Neatly skillful and quick in one's movements.
example: The artist's deft hands made the painting come to life.

definition: Not having any serious purpose or value.
example: She was criticized for spending money on frivolous items.

definition: Impressive because of unnecessary largeness or grandeur; pompous.
example: His grandiose plans were impressive but impractical.

definition: Of vital importance; crucial.
example: It is imperative that we meet the deadline.

definition: Not able to be seen through; not transparent.
example: The glass was opaque with steam.

definition: A statement that contradicts itself but might still be true.
example: It is a paradox that in such a rich country there can be so much poverty.

definition: To voluntarily cease to keep or claim; give up.
example: She decided to relinquish her position as manager.

definition: Understand (a difficult problem or an enigmatic person) after much thought.
example: She couldn't fathom why he had left so suddenly.

definition: Impossible to subdue or defeat.
example: The indomitable spirit of the team carried them through the season.

definition: A passionate expression of grief or sorrow.
example: They lamented the passing of their beloved grandmother.

definition: A person one knows slightly, but who is not a close friend.
example: I met an old acquaintance at the conference.

definition: One's opponent in a contest, conflict, or dispute.
example: He fought against his adversary with all his might.

definition: Very old or old-fashioned.
example: The museum had an exhibit of archaic tools and weapons.

definition: Deserving praise and commendation.
example: Her efforts to clean up the environment were truly laudable.

definition: An inclination or natural tendency to behave in a particular way.
example: He has a propensity for making spontaneous decisions.

definition: Provide evidence to support or prove the truth of.
example: The scientist was able to substantiate his hypothesis with compelling data.

definition: A very large quantity of something.
example: The garden boasts an abundance of flowers in the spring.

definition: A strong or habitual liking for something or tendency to do something.
example: She has a penchant for solving complex puzzles.

definition: Spread throughout (something); pervade.
example: The aroma of coffee permeated the entire room.

definition: Disagreement, typically when prolonged, public, and heated.
example: The new policy has sparked widespread controversy.

definition: Having or showing keen mental discernment and good judgment; wise or shrewd.
example: The sagacious leader made decisions that benefited the entire community.

definition: Formally put an end to (a system, practice, or institution).
example: The government voted to abolish the outdated law.

definition: Make minor changes to (a text, piece of legislation, etc.) in order to make it fairer, more accurate, or more up-to-date.
example: The committee agreed to amend the proposal.

definition: Be of the same opinion; agree.
example: I completely concur with your views on the matter.

definition: (Of a person or their behavior) unconventional and slightly strange.
example: His eccentric habits made him the talk of the neighborhood.

definition: Serving as a desirable model; representing the best of its kind.
example: She received an award for her exemplary performance.

definition: About to happen.
example: The dark clouds indicated that a storm was imminent.

definition: Certain to happen; unavoidable.
example: Given the current trends, it was inevitable that the company would experience a decline in profits.

definition: Producing a great deal of profit.
example: She turned her hobby of baking into a lucrative business.

definition: Not easily upset or excited; calm and peaceful.
example: The placid lake offered a perfect place for a quiet afternoon of fishing.

definition: Avoiding the company of other people; solitary.
example: The author became increasingly reclusive after the success of her first novel.

definition: Clear (someone) of blame or suspicion.
example: The evidence provided was enough to vindicate him of any wrongdoing.

definition: Make (suffering, deficiency, or a problem) less severe.
example: The medication helped to alleviate her headaches.

definition: Hesitating or doubting; not to be relied upon; suspect.
example: He made a dubious claim about the effectiveness of the product.

definition: Characterized by vulgar or pretentious display; designed to impress or attract notice.
example: The ostentatious mansion was filled with gold-plated furniture and crystal chandeliers.

definition: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically in a way that is based on practical rather than theoretical considerations.
example: She took a pragmatic approach to problem-solving, focusing on what worked rather than what was ideal.

definition: To distribute resources or duties for a particular purpose.
example: The company decided to allocate a portion of its budget to research and development.

definition: To stick fast to a surface or substance; to believe in and follow the practices of.
example: You must adhere to the safety regulations while working in the lab.

definition: To set to the value or put in the condition appropriate to the start of an operation.
example: Before using the software, you need to initialize the setup configuration.

definition: Coming before a main event or activity, especially as an introduction.
example: The preliminary results of the study show promise but require further investigation.

definition: No longer produced or used; out of date.
example: The rapid advancement of technology has made many older devices obsolete.

definition: Keeping careful watch for possible danger or difficulties.
example: The security staff remained vigilant throughout the night to ensure the safety of the premises.

definition: Expressed clearly; easy to understand.
example: Her explanation of the complex theory was so lucid that even those not familiar with the subject could understand it.

definition: Relevant or applicable to a particular matter; apposite.
example: The lawyer presented all the pertinent facts regarding the case.

definition: Free from disturbance; calm.
example: The tranquil lake offered a perfect setting for a peaceful retreat.

definition: Gentle and kind; not harmful in effect.
example: The doctor assured us that the tumor was benign and not a threat to her health.

definition: Difficult to interpret or understand; mysterious.
example: The artist's enigmatic smile made the portrait even more intriguing.

definition: (Of something regarded as unpleasant) continuing without pause or interruption.
example: The incessant noise from the construction site made it hard to concentrate.

definition: Perceptible by touch; clear and definite real.
example: The tension in the room was almost tangible.

definition: Lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern.
example: The student's apathy towards the project was evident in his lack of effort.

definition: Find a way around (an obstacle).
example: They found a way to circumvent the blocked road by taking a detour.

definition: (Of a place) deserted of people and in a state of bleak and dismal emptiness.
example: The once bustling town was now desolate and forgotten.

definition: Based on or serving as a hypothesis; supposed but not necessarily real or true.
example: She discussed a hypothetical situation to illustrate her point.

definition: Acting with or showing care and thought for the future.
example: It's always prudent to save some money for emergencies.

definition: A confusing and difficult problem or question.
example: The detective faced a conundrum that required all his skills to solve.

definition: Having no particular interest or sympathy; unconcerned.
example: She was indifferent to the praise and criticism alike.

definition: To make less severe, serious, or painful.
example: The government has taken steps to mitigate the effects of the economic downturn.

definition: To restore friendly relations between.
example: After years of estrangement, they finally managed to reconcile their differences.

definition: Based on random choice or personal whim, rather than any reason or system.
example: The committee's selection process seemed completely arbitrary.

definition: The expression or holding of opinions at variance with those previously, commonly, or officially held.
example: There was no dissent from this view.

definition: Curious or inquiring.
example: She was a very inquisitive student, always asking the most interesting questions.

definition: Done according to a systematic or established form of procedure.
example: He is very methodical in his approach to work.

definition: Deserving blame or punishment.
example: His actions were morally reprehensible.

definition: Not friendly or forthcoming; cool and distant.
example: They tried to stay aloof from the politics of the day.

definition: Not able to be corrected, improved, or reformed.
example: He is an incorrigible liar.

definition: (of a person or manner) feeling or appearing casually calm and relaxed; not displaying anxiety, interest, or enthusiasm.
example: She gave a nonchalant shrug.

definition: To completely destroy or put an end to something.
example: The government launched a campaign to eradicate polio.

definition: Continuing without pause or interruption.
example: The incessant noise from the construction site was driving us crazy.

definition: Severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance.
example: The monk’s austere lifestyle involved minimal comforts.

definition: To regard or represent as being of little worth.
example: He never missed an opportunity to disparage his competitors.

definition: Mental calmness, composure, and evenness of temper, especially in a difficult situation.
example: She accepted both the good and the bad with equanimity.

definition: To show someone to be involved in a crime or to convey indirectly through what one says.
example: The evidence implicated him in the robbery.

definition: Having or showing no skill; clumsy.
example: His inept handling of the situation only made it worse.

definition: Dried out with heat or extremely thirsty.
example: The travelers were parched after walking through the desert.

definition: A survey or review of a past course of events or period of time.
example: In retrospect, it was clear that we should have taken a different route.

definition: Of considerable importance, size, or worth.
example: He made a substantial contribution to the project.

definition: Difficulties or misfortune.
example: She showed great courage in the face of adversity.

definition: Concise and exact use of words in writing or speech.
example: The speaker's brevity kept the audience engaged throughout the presentation.

definition: Believing that people are motivated by self-interest; distrustful of human sincerity or integrity.
example: She was cynical about the politician’s promises, suspecting they were just a ploy for votes.

definition: To depart from an established course or norm.
example: Usually a careful driver, he would never deviate from the road rules.

definition: A person or thing that is a perfect example of a particular quality or type.
example: The actress is the epitome of grace and elegance.

definition: Uncalled for; lacking good reason; unwarranted.
example: The movie was criticized for its gratuitous violence.

definition: A thing that provides resistance, delay, or obstruction to something or someone.
example: Lack of funding was a serious hindrance to the research project.

definition: Inborn; natural.
example: She has an innate ability to understand complex mathematical concepts.

definition: Not securely held or in position; dangerously likely to fall or collapse.
example: She stood on a precarious ladder while painting the top of the wall.

definition: Difficult to find, catch, or achieve.
example: The thief was elusive, managing to escape the police every time.
